pullRequest.body:
We define the functor which associates a condensed set to a topological space, with the correct universe levels.

```suggestion
  preserves J _ :=
    { preservesLimit := fun {K} =>
```
I think it would make sense to add the `rfl` lemma asserting `yonedaPresheaf F Y = F.op ⋙ yonedaPresheaf' Y`.

```suggestion
  have h : PreservesFiniteProducts G.op :=
    { preserves := fun J _ => by
```

```suggestion
  have := h.1 J
  have := h'.1 J
```
also works.
Are you planning to develop the API of `TopCat.toCondensed` and `topCatToCondensed` in a future PR? Should one or both be marked `@[simps]`?

I tried that but got linter errors such as
```
Left-hand side simplifies from
  ((topCatToCondensed.map f).val.app x✝ g) a✝
to
  ((topCatToCondensed.map f).val.app x✝ g) a✝
using
  simp only [compHausToTop_obj]
```

I'm slightly afraid that at some point in the future someone will look for something like this in a file called something like `Mathlib/Topology/Category/TopCat/Yoneda.lean`, not find anything and then rebuild it, so that we end up with multiple developments of this concept. Do you think that it would make sense to move the parts of this file that are not specific to condensed sets into `Topology/Category/TopCat/*`?

This seems very close to an example of [CategoryTheory.ColimitAdj.restrictedYoneda](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Presheaf.html#CategoryTheory.ColimitAdj.restrictedYoneda) except that it has a `smallCategory` requirement that can probably be lifted (at least from that definition).

To use something like that it seems that I would need `Y` to be an object of a category, which would be `TopCat.{w'}`, and the functor `A` from `restrictedYoneda` would be some sort of topological `ULift`, which we don't have. Or do you have something else in mind?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Condensed): functor from `TopCat.{u+1}` to `CondensedSet.{u}`
